Module swirlds.platform
Package com.swirlds.platform

Class Utilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirlds.platform.Utilities
  • public class Utilities
extends Object
    This is a collection of static utility methods, such as for comparing and deep cloning of arrays.

    • Constructor Summary

      Utilities()

    • Method Detail

      • deepClone

        public static long[][] deepClone​(long[][] original)
        Do a deep clone of a 2D array. Here, "deep" means that after doing x=deepClone(y), x won't be affected by changes to any part of y, such as assigning to y or to y[0] or to y[0][0].
        Parameters:
        original - the original array
        Returns:
        the deep clone

      • deepClone

        public static byte[][] deepClone​(byte[][] original)
        Do a deep clone of a 2D array. Here, "deep" means that after doing x=deepClone(y), x won't be affected by changes to any part of y, such as assigning to y or to y[0] or to y[0][0].
        Parameters:
        original - the original array
        Returns:
        the deep clone

      • deepCloneBySerializing

        public static Object deepCloneBySerializing​(Object original)
        Do a deep clone of any serialiazable object that can reach only other serializable objects through following references.
        Parameters:
        original - the object to clone
        Returns:
        the clone

                                                                 Class<T> fastCopyableClass)
                                                          throws Exception
        read a FastCopyable array from the given stream
        Type Parameters:
        T - the FastCopyable class that the array will consist of
        Parameters:
        stream - the stream to read from
        fastCopyableClass - The class that of objects that is contained in the array, the class must implement FastCopyable and must have a default constructor
        Returns:
        the array that was read
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if there are any problems during the operation

      • toBytes

        public static byte[] toBytes​(long n)
        Convert the given long to bytes, big endian.
        Parameters:
        n - the long to convert
        Returns:
        a big-endian representation of n as an array of Long.BYTES bytes

      • toBytes

        public static void toBytes​(long n,
                           byte[] bytes,
                           int start)
        Convert the given long to bytes, big endian, and put them into the array, starting at index start
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array to hold the Long.BYTES bytes of result
        n - the long to convert to bytes
        start - the bytes are written to Long.BYTES elements of the array, starting with this index

      • toLong

        public static long toLong​(byte[] b)
        convert the given byte array to a long
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to convert (at least 8 bytes)
        Returns:
        the long that was represented by the array

      • toLong

        public static long toLong​(byte[] b,
                          int start)
        convert part of the given byte array to a long, starting with index start
        Parameters:
        b - the byte array to convert
        start - the index of the first byte (most significant byte) of the 8 bytes to convert
        Returns:
        the long

      • err

        public static Object err​(Throwable e)
        Quickly return an object whose toString() calculates and returns the string representation of the given exception. If Settings.logStack is true, then it includes the exception name and a full stack trace with newlines after each level on the stack. If it is false, then only the name is included.

        This Object can be passed to Log4J2 logging, and the work of creating the complicated string will only happen when the appropriate logging marker is active.

        Parameters:
        e - the exception
        Returns:
        a parameterless lambda which, when evaluated, returns the string.

      • getNormalisedStringBytes

        public static byte[] getNormalisedStringBytes​(String s)
        Normalizes the string in accordance with the Swirlds default normalization method (NFD) and returns the bytes of that normalized String encoded in the Swirlds default charset (UTF8). This is important for having a consistent method of converting Strings to bytes that will guarantee that two identical strings will have an identical byte representation
        Parameters:
        s - the String to be converted to bytes
        Returns:
        a byte representation of the String

      • writeNormalisedString

        public static void writeNormalisedString​(DataOutputStream out,
                                         String s)
                                  throws IOException
        Normalizes the string in accordance with the Swirlds default normalization method (NFD) and writes it to the output stream encoded in the Swirlds default charset (UTF8). This is important for having a consistent method of converting Strings to bytes that will guarantee that two identical strings will have an identical byte representation
        Parameters:
        out - the stream to write to
        s - the String to be converted and written
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there are any problems during the operation

      • readNormalisedString

        public static String readNormalisedString​(DataInputStream in)
                                   throws IOException
        Reads a String encoded in the Swirlds default charset (UTF8) from an input stream
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to read from
        Returns:
        the String read
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there are any problems during the operation
